channel.title: Obstacles do damage
channel.description:
I need some help with obstacles, I want them to do damage. Say as a swinging pendulum in Rogue's Den Agility Course.
How would I make that attack a player standing in the coords, when the ball hits him?
I need some help, and I tried different ways as set coords boolean. Such as object Damage, but that didn't work.

item.title: Obstacles do damage
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Encryption, post:5, topic:418077”]You know what, I think I found out my problem with your help.
So what you’re saying is I can make an object give damage, like thieving an npc?
Also, I can add an emote to it such as player thieving stun.

You gave me an IDEA Buddy! = P

If you know an easier way to make checking better, I’d like to know. Thanks! :)[/quote]Not for what your wanting to do sorry would be an interesting item on a server though I must admit.

Read full topic

item.title: Obstacles do damage
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:418077”]Do you have to click the pendulum to get passed it? If so then you could just handle it in the Object action packet.

If you just walk past it, it makes it a little bit more difficult (as you have discovered).

the only thing I can think of would be to add a list of stipulations to the walking part of the server, but eventually it would become filled with garbage (like the common process())[/quote]

You can’t click it, I could edit that in the client but I’d rather the real thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Obstacles do damage
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Do you have to click the pendulum to get passed it? If so then you could just handle it in the Object action packet.

If you just walk past it, it makes it a little bit more difficult (as you have discovered).

the only thing I can think of would be to add a list of stipulations to the walking part of the server, but eventually it would become filled with garbage (like the common process())

Read full topic

item.title: Obstacles do damage
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

You know what, I think I found out my problem with your help.
So what you’re saying is I can make an object give damage, like thieving an npc?
Also, I can add an emote to it such as player thieving stun.

You gave me an IDEA Buddy! = P

If you know an easier way to make checking better, I’d like to know. Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Obstacles do damage
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Encryption, post:3, topic:418077”]Say the swinging pendulum reaches(hits) the player, in x coords. I’m trying make it give damage.

[/quote]I know for the hit part it would be the same way you make a person take damage with thief but I don’t know how you would indicate that at specific coords. Wouldn’t that also be a little laggy? Considering you would be checking constantly to see if its a fail or good run?

Read full topic
